concise_definition: n. 肠道, 勇气, 胆量; v. 剖开, 取出内脏

definitions.explanation_en: The internal organs of the body, especially the intestines; often used in plural form to refer to the digestive tract.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指人体的内脏器官，尤指肠道；通常以复数形式出现，指消化系统。
definitions.example_en: He had to undergo surgery to remove part of his guts after the accident.
definitions.example_cn: 事故发生后，他不得不接受手术切除部分肠道。

definitions.explanation_en: Courage or determination to do something difficult, dangerous, or unpleasant; often used informally to express bravery in the face of fear.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指做困难、危险或不愉快之事所需的勇气或决心；常用于非正式语境，表达在恐惧面前的胆量。
definitions.example_en: It took guts to stand up to the bully and speak the truth.
definitions.example_cn: 敢于站出来对抗霸凌者并说出真相，需要极大的勇气。

definitions.explanation_en: To remove the internal organs from an animal, especially during butchering or preparing for cooking.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在屠宰或烹饪前取出动物的内脏。
definitions.example_en: The fisherman gutted the trout right on the bank of the river.
definitions.example_cn: 渔夫直接在河岸边剖开了鳟鱼的肚子。

comparison.analysis: “Courage” 是一个正式、通用的词，指面对危险、痛苦或恐惧时的道德或精神上的勇敢，适用于所有语境。而 “guts” 是非正式口语词，更强调一种原始、本能的胆量，常带有一种粗犷或不拘小节的意味。
“Innards” 与 “guts” 都可指内脏，但 “innards” 更偏向于科学或幽默语境，语气略带生硬或戏谑；而 “guts” 更口语化、常用，且在比喻义（勇气）上不可替代。
“Nerve” 也可表示胆量，但更侧重于无礼、鲁莽或厚颜无耻的胆子（如：You’ve got nerve to ask for a raise!），有时含贬义；而 “guts” 通常为褒义，强调正面的勇敢和决心。
